title: Ravichandran Ashwin announces retirement from international cricket after Gabba Test - The Indian Express
summary:
Ravichandran Ashwin Announces Retirement from International Cricket

Publication Date: December 18, 2024
Source: Indian Express

India’s premier spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket following the third Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test in Brisbane. His retirement announcement came after a rain break during Day 5, where he shared an emotional moment with Virat Kohli.

  • Ashwin concludes a notable 14-year career, having taken 537 wickets in Test matches, making him India's second-highest Test wicket-taker.
  • He has recorded 37 Test five-fors and was part of India's World Cup-winning squad in 2011.
  • Ashwin plans to continue his cricketing journey in club-level competitions and the IPL.
“This will be my last day as an Indian cricketer in all formats at the international level,” - Ravichandran Ashwin

Ashwin will continue to contribute in franchise cricket and has rejoined the Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2025.
newTitle: Ravichandran Ashwin Announces Retirement from International Cricket

summary:
Did Vinod Kambli convert to Christanity due to wife Andrea Hewit? Fell in love after seeing former model's poster...

Publication Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli's love story with his second wife Andrea Hewit includes his conversion to Christianity.

  • Kambli fell in love with model Andrea after seeing her poster.
  • He converted to Christianity and had a Catholic wedding in 2014.
  • The couple has two children who are raised as Catholics.
  • Kambli has openly mentioned that he feels scared of Andrea, who has banned him from drinking.
  • Andrea has been caring for Kambli's health, especially after his heart attack in 2013.
  • Recently, Kambli was seen in a frail condition and expressed his desire to return to rehab with Andrea's support.
“I will go back to rehab again if wife Andrea Hewit is supporting me.”

The story emphasizes the transformative power of love and the commitment Kambli made for his family.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Converts to Christianity for Love

title: Kohli, Gambhir, Rohit's wild celebrations at saving follow-on stuns Australia dressing room: 'India didn't wana bat…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Australia Surprised by India's Wild Celebrations After Avoiding Follow-On

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the surprised reactions of the Australian cricket team to India's exuberant celebrations after they managed to avoid the follow-on during the third Test at the Gabba, Brisbane.

  • Nathan Lyon noted that Australia's dressing room was taken aback by India's celebrations.
  • India's captain Rohit Sharma, head coach Gautam Gambhir, and star player Virat Kohli were notably enthusiastic after a crucial boundary by Akash Deep.
  • Despite being at risk of enforcing the follow-on, India showcased great determination, particularly from their lower order in batting.
  • Lyon commented on India's apparent reluctance to bat if the follow-on was enforced, especially in fading light.
“We were surprised by some of their reactions...they're feeling confident in where they are in the game.” - Nathan Lyon

This match exemplifies the intensity and competitive spirit in cricket, with India celebrating what some might see as small victories amidst a challenging match.
newTitle: Australia Surprised by India's Wild Celebrations After Avoiding Follow-On

title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 5 Live Score: Bumrah, Siraj, Deep on fire as AUS top 5 collapses - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 5 Live Score: Jaiswal vs Starc battle resumes as IND chase 275, AUS gun for 10 wickets

Date: November 23, 2024   Source: Hindustan Times

As the final day of the third Test between India and Australia unfolds at the Gabba, Australia has set a challenging target of 275 runs for India to chase down, having declared their second innings on 89/7.

  • Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets, with Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj contributing two each.
  • India was all out for 260, leaving Australia with a 185-run lead.
  • The match has been affected by rain, which could impact the final outcome.
  • India's top scores include KL Rahul with 82 and Ravindra Jadeja with 77.
"Australia have declared on 89/7, India need 275 to win the third Test"

As the day progresses, the match remains finely poised with both teams having a shot at victory, depending on the weather and the resilience of India's batting lineup.

title: 'Rohit Sharma will step down as India captain after Australia tour if...': Sunil Gavaskar's staggering claim - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rohit Sharma May Step Down as Captain if Poor Form Continues, Says Sunil Gavaskar

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has claimed that Rohit Sharma may resign as India's cricket captain following the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series in Australia if his performance does not improve.

  • Rohit Sharma has scored only 152 runs in his last 13 innings, averaging 11.83.
  • He has faced criticism for a lack of runs against Bangladesh and New Zealand.
  • With moves to bat at No. 6, he managed just 19 runs in the ongoing series against Australia.
  • Gavaskar suggests Rohit may proactively step down if form does not improve in the next matches.
  • Rohit's possible retirement from the format has been a topic of speculation among fans.
“He’s a very conscientious cricketer, he will not want to be a burden on the team.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The future of Rohit Sharma as captain hangs in the balance as he faces a crucial series of performances ahead.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma May Step Down as Captain if Poor Form Continues, Says Sunil Gavaskar

title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Watch: Akash Deep says 'sorry sorry' after irritating Travis Head | Cricket News - The Times of India
summary:
Watch: Akash Deep says 'sorry sorry' after irritating Travis Head

Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

The fifth day of the third Test between India and Australia was marked by a light-hearted incident involving Akash Deep and Travis Head. Deep, who had been playing well, unintentionally confused Head during the game.

  • Day 5 of the third Test saw India bowled out for 260 runs.
  • Akash Deep had a notable partnership with Jasprit Bumrah, scoring a defiant 47 runs for the last wicket.
  • A humorous moment occurred when Deep accidentally dropped the ball from his pads, frustrating Head.
  • Deep lightened the moment by apologizing with a 'sorry sorry,' leading to laughter from commentators.
  • Shortly after, Deep was stumped by Alex Carey, allowing Australia to take a significant lead.
“Sorry sorry,” Akash Deep said, prompting laughter from commentators and a wry smile from Travis Head.

This incident brought some levity to the tense match conditions and showcased the lighter side of cricket amidst competitive play.
newTitle: Akash Deep Apologizes After Misunderstanding with Travis Head

summary:
Bilkul Hi Nahi Hai Bhookh: Shubman Gill Blasted By Ex-Pakistan Star After Yet Another Poor Show

Published on: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV

Shubman Gill has faced criticism following his poor performance in the Test series against Australia, with former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali pointing out his lack of hunger for runs.

  • Shubman Gill dismissed for just 1 run in the third Test against Australia.
  • Basit Ali emphasizes the importance of focusing on performance instead of comparing oneself to established players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • India's team avoided a follow-on but still trails by 193 runs after scoring 252 for nine.
  • Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul were key contributors, scoring 77 and 84 runs respectively.
  • The five-match series is currently tied at 1-1.
"Gill ko toh bilkul hi nahi hai bhookh (Gill is not hungry at all for runs)." - Basit Ali

The criticism highlights the pressure on young players in high-stakes cricket, especially in challenging Test series.
newTitle: Bilkul Hi Nahi Hai Bhookh: Shubman Gill Blasted By Ex-Pakistan Star After Yet Another Poor Show

title: Gautam Gambhir, Abhishek Nayar urged to have 'honest conversations' with Virat Kohli: 'What solution can they give?' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gautam Gambhir, Abhishek Nayar urged to have 'honest conversations' with Virat Kohli: 'What solution can they give?'

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Devang Gandhi emphasizes the need for head coach Gautam Gambhir and assistant Abhishek Nayar to have candid discussions with Virat Kohli regarding his recent performance issues, particularly his struggles with balls outside off-stump during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Gandhi believes that Kohli's mental attitude and adaptability at age 36 are crucial.
  • He argues that Gambhir and Nayar can only facilitate discussions but cannot coach Kohli directly.
  • The duo needs to build mutual trust before they can offer effective advice to Kohli.
  • Gandhi questions whether Kohli can adapt his approach to scoring runs at this stage in his career.
Gandhi stated, "At this stage, you can't coach them. Coaching happens at junior level."

In conclusion, both Gandhi and others stress the importance of honest dialogue to determine what adjustments Kohli feels he needs to make.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir and Abhishek Nayar Address Virat Kohli's Challenges

Akash Deep apologised to Travis Head following a bizarre exchange during the third Test match between India and Australia in Brisbane. The incident occurred when Akash Deep missed a ball, leading to an unexpected interaction with Head.

  • Akash Deep attempted an aggressive shot against Nathan Lyon.
  • The ball got stuck in Deep's pads, which he threw to the ground, causing confusion with Travis Head.
  • Despite the awkward moment, Deep apologised and play continued smoothly.
  • The day was marked by multiple delays due to weather conditions.
Don't think Travis Head loved that — cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) December 18, 2024

Ultimately, Travis Head dismissed Akash Deep, contributing to the end of India's innings.

title: Prithvi Shaw's Instagram outburst backfires as youngster handed stern warning: 'Just by looking at his frame…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Prithvi Shaw Faces Criticism After Instagram Outburst

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prithvi Shaw, once the celebrated young talent in Indian cricket, has found himself under scrutiny after being dropped from Mumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad due to fitness and performance issues. Following his exclusion, he took to Instagram to defend himself by sharing his List-A statistics, admitting that he feels he is not good enough.

  • Shaw needs to improve his fitness and discipline after being omitted from the Vijay Hazare Trophy squad.
  • Despite once being dubbed the future star of Indian cricket, his opportunities have dwindled with only 12 international matches played.
  • Performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy was subpar, with an average below 25.
  • He went unsold in the IPL auction, raising further concerns about his career trajectory.
  • Coaches emphasize the need for hard work and commitment to realize his potential.
"Just by looking at his frame, the fitness issues are there for everyone to see." - Source from the Mumbai Cricket Association

In conclusion, Shaw's situation serves as a reminder of the delicate balance between talent and discipline in sports, highlighting the challenges athletes face in maintaining their careers amidst scrutiny.
newTitle: Prithvi Shaw Faces Criticism After Instagram Outburst and Omission from Vijay Hazare Trophy Squad

title: Mitchell Santner officially appointed New Zealand's white-ball captain - Cricbuzz
Santner named New Zealand's white-ball captain - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Mitchell Santner Appointed New Zealand White-Ball Captain

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Mitchell Santner has been appointed as New Zealand's new white-ball captain, succeeding Kane Williamson after the T20 World Cup. His first series will be against Sri Lanka from late December.

  • Santner captained in 24 T20Is and four ODIs prior to this role.
  • The Champions Trophy in February will be the first major event under his captaincy.
  • He expressed gratitude for the opportunity and excitement for the challenges ahead.
  • Head coach Gary Stead highlighted the need to manage Tom Latham's workload as Test captain.
  • Santner has been recognized for his calm demeanor and respect among teammates.
  • Despite a light Test schedule in 2025, Santner has shown strong performance in recent matches.
“It's obviously a huge honour and a privilege to be asked,” Santner stated regarding his captaincy.

This leadership change marks a significant moment for New Zealand cricket as they prepare for upcoming competitions.
newTitle: Mitchell Santner Appointed New Zealand White-Ball Captain

summary:
Elon Musk and Sundar Pichai React to Jasprit Bumrah's 'Google It' Remark

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

After Jasprit Bumrah's witty remark about his batting, Google CEO Sundar Pichai praised him on X, while Elon Musk added a brief compliment.

  • Jasprit Bumrah humorously suggested that a journalist should use Google to assess his batting skills.

title: Sanju Samson excluded from Kerala’s Vijay Hazare Trophy squad after not attending camp - The Indian Express
summary:
Sanju Samson Excluded from Kerala’s Vijay Hazare Trophy Squad

Publication Date: October 12, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

India's wicket-keeper Sanju Samson has been left out of Kerala's squad for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy after failing to attend the team's preparatory camp.

  • Samson led Kerala to a third-place finish in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy but did not report for the subsequent team camp.
  • The squad was formed after a brief camp in Wayanad, which Samson missed due to an email stating his unavailability.
  • Salman Nizar will captain the team in Samson's absence.
  • Samson's last 50-over game was during India's tour of South Africa in December 2023, where he scored an unbeaten century.
“Sanju had sent an email stating that he would not be available for the camp. Naturally, we only considered those who were part of the sessions for selection.” - Vinod S Kumar, KCA Secretary

In conclusion, Sanju Samson's absence from the camp has resulted in his exclusion from the upcoming tournament, with the team moving forward with new leadership under Salman Nizar.
newTitle: Sanju Samson Excluded from Kerala’s Vijay Hazare Trophy Squad

title: Man Utd release Alejandro Garnacho statement as star follows Cristiano Ronaldo's footsteps - Express
Dottin, Matthews make easy work of India in series-levelling win - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
West Indies Levels T20I Series Against India with Dominant Win

Date: Not specified

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

West Indies secured a commanding nine-wicket victory over India, leveling the T20I series with a stellar performance from captain Hayley Matthews.

  • West Indies scored 160 for 1, chasing down India's total of 159 for 9.
  • Hayley Matthews was the standout performer, scoring an unbeaten 85 from 54 balls.
  • India's Smriti Mandhana top-scored for her team with 62 runs.
  • West Indies bounced back strongly after losing nine consecutive T20I matches against India.
  • Deandra Dottin and Afy Fletcher took two wickets each, helping restrict India to a low score.
“The series couldn't have been leveled with a more emphatic chase.”

The West Indies' performance showcased their batting depth and resilience, setting the stage for an exciting conclusion to the series.
newTitle: West Indies Levels T20I Series Against India with Dominant Win

title: Heather Knight: Lack of DRS 'shows the status' of women's Test cricket - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Heather Knight: Lack of DRS 'shows the status' of women's Test cricket

Publication Date: Recent
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Heather Knight, the captain of England's women's cricket team, expressed concerns over the absence of the Decision Review System (DRS) in their recent historic Test against South Africa, interpreting it as a reflection of the game's status. England achieved a significant 286-run victory, marking their first win in this format in a decade.

  • The absence of DRS was noted during contentious umpiring decisions.
  • South Africa ended their innings at 64 all out in their fourth innings.
  • Multiple umpiring calls went against South Africa, which could have been resolved with DRS.
  • South Africa's coach, Mandla Mashimbyi, found the decision process surrounding the calls confusing.
  • Knight pointed out the financial implications responsible for not utilizing DRS.
“It’s probably a sign of the status of this game, maybe, that we didn’t have it, which is a bit frustrating.” - Heather Knight

The lack of DRS has raised questions about investment in women’s cricket, especially given that Cricket South Africa reported a profit of R815 million for the fiscal year.
newTitle: Heather Knight Critiques Lack of DRS in Women's Test Cricket
